solution.text:
Let Asmita's daughter's age be y years.
Then Asmita's present age is _{j}_y years.
_{k}_ years later, Asmita's age will be _{j}_y+_{k}_ and her Daughter's age will be y+_{k}_.
According to question ,
_{j}_y+_{k}_=_{l}_(y+_{k}_)
_{{j-l}}_y=_{k}_(_{l}_-1)
y=_{{(l-1)*k}}_/_{{j-l}}_
y=_{{trunc((Decimal(l)*(k-1))/(j-l),2)}}_

content.text: Asmita's present age is _{j}_ times her daughter's age. _{k}_ years later she will be _{l}_ times her daughter's age. What is her daughter's age in years? Solve up to two decimal places.
